p: Independent simian immunodeficiency virus (SIV) transfers to humans have established twelve different known human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) groups [1]– [10]. Pandemic HIV-1 group M, and group N descend from SIVcpz endemic in West Central African chimpanzees [1]– [5], while the closest relatives of HIV-1 groups O and P are SIVs infecting western lowland gorillas (SIVgor) in the same region [1], [10], [11]. All known HIV-2 groups (A–H) descend from SIVsmm endemic in sooty mangabeys [4]– [9], which inhabit a strip of forested coast in West Africa [9], [12], [13].
